verses.verse: Woe <S%H1945><s%> to the bloody <S%H1818><s%> city! <S%H5892><s%> it is all <S%H3605><s%> full <S%H4392><s%> of lies <S%H3585><s%> and robbery; <S%H6563><s%> the prey <S%H2964><s%> departeth <S%H4185><s%> not; <S%H3808><s%>

The noise <S%H6963><s%> of a whip, <S%H7752><s%> and the noise <S%H6963><s%> of the rattling <S%H7494><s%> of the wheels, <S%H212><s%> and of the prancing <S%H1725><s%> horses, <S%H5483><s%> and of the jumping <S%H7540><s%> chariots. <S%H4818><s%>

The horseman <S%H6571><s%> lifteth up <S%H5927><s%> both the bright <S%H3851><s%> sword <S%H2719><s%> and the glittering <S%H1300><s%> spear: <S%H2595><s%> and there is a multitude <S%H7230><s%> of slain, <S%H2491><s%> and a great number <S%H3514><s%> of carcasses; <S%H6297><s%> and there is none <S%H369><s%> end <S%H7097><s%> of their corpses; <S%H1472><s%> they stumble <S%H3782><s%> upon their corpses: <S%H1472><s%>

Because of the multitude <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7230><s%> of the whoredoms <S%H2183><s%> of the well favored <S%H2896><s%> <S%H2580><s%> harlot, <S%H2181><s%> the mistress <S%H1172><s%> of witchcrafts, <S%H3785><s%> that selleth <S%H4376><s%> nations <S%H1471><s%> through her whoredoms, <S%H2183><s%> and families <S%H4940><s%> through her witchcrafts. <S%H3785><s%>

Behold, <S%H2009><s%> I am against <S%H413><s%> thee, saith <S%H5002><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> of hosts; <S%H6635><s%> and I will discover <S%H1540><s%> thy skirts <S%H7757><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> thy face, <S%H6440><s%> and I will show <S%H7200><s%> the nations <S%H1471><s%> thy nakedness, <S%H4626><s%> and the kingdoms <S%H4467><s%> thy shame. <S%H7036><s%>
And I will cast <S%H7993><s%> abominable filth <S%H8251><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> thee, and make thee vile, <S%H5034><s%> and will set <S%H7760><s%> thee as a gazingstock. <S%H7210><s%>

And it shall come to pass, <S%H1961><s%> that all <S%H3605><s%> they that look upon <S%H7200><s%> thee shall flee <S%H5074><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> thee, and say, <S%H559><s%> Nineveh <S%H5210><s%> is laid waste: <S%H7703><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> will bemoan <S%H5110><s%> her? whence <S%H4480><s%> <S%H370><s%> shall I seek <S%H1245><s%> comforters <S%H5162><s%> for thee?

Art thou better <S%H3190><s%> than populous <S%H528><s%> No, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4996><s%> that was situate <S%H3427><s%> among the rivers, <S%H2975><s%> that had the waters <S%H4325><s%> round about <S%H5439><s%> it, whose <S%H834><s%> rampart <S%H2426><s%> was the sea, <S%H3220><s%> and her wall <S%H2346><s%> was from the sea? <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3220><s%>

Ethiopia <S%H3568><s%> and Egypt <S%H4714><s%> were her strength, <S%H6109><s%> and it was infinite; <S%H369><s%> <S%H7097><s%> Put <S%H6316><s%> and Lubim <S%H3864><s%> were <S%H1961><s%> thy helpers. <S%H5833><s%>

Yet <S%H1571><s%> was she <S%H1931><s%> carried away, <S%H1473><s%> she went <S%H1980><s%> into captivity: <S%H7628><s%> her young children <S%H5768><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> were dashed in pieces <S%H7376><s%> at the top <S%H7218><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> the streets: <S%H2351><s%> and they cast <S%H3032><s%> lots <S%H1486><s%> for <S%H5921><s%> her honorable men, <S%H3513><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> her great men <S%H1419><s%> were bound <S%H7576><s%> in chains. <S%H2131><s%>

Thou <S%H859><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> shalt be drunken: <S%H7937><s%> thou shalt be <S%H1961><s%> hid, <S%H5956><s%> thou <S%H859><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> shalt seek <S%H1245><s%> strength <S%H4581><s%> because of the enemy. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H341><s%>

All <S%H3605><s%> thy strongholds <S%H4013><s%> shall be like fig trees <S%H8384><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> the firstripe figs: <S%H1061><s%> if <S%H518><s%> they be shaken, <S%H5128><s%> they shall even fall <S%H5307><s%> into <S%H5921><s%> the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of the eater. <S%H398><s%>

Behold, <S%H2009><s%> thy people <S%H5971><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of thee are women: <S%H802><s%> the gates <S%H8179><s%> of thy land <S%H776><s%> shall be set wide open <S%H6605><s%> <S%H6605><s%> unto thine enemies: <S%H341><s%> the fire <S%H784><s%> shall devour <S%H398><s%> thy bars. <S%H1280><s%>

Draw <S%H7579><s%> thee waters <S%H4325><s%> for the siege, <S%H4692><s%> fortify <S%H2388><s%> thy strongholds: <S%H4013><s%> go <S%H935><s%> into clay, <S%H2916><s%> and tread <S%H7429><s%> the mortar, <S%H2563><s%> make strong <S%H2388><s%> the brickkiln. <S%H4404><s%>

There <S%H8033><s%> shall the fire <S%H784><s%> devour <S%H398><s%> thee; the sword <S%H2719><s%> shall cut thee off, <S%H3772><s%> it shall eat thee up <S%H398><s%> like the cankerworm: <S%H3218><s%> make thyself many <S%H3513><s%> as the cankerworm, <S%H3218><s%> make thyself many <S%H3513><s%> as the locusts. <S%H697><s%>

Thou hast multiplied <S%H7235><s%> thy merchants <S%H7402><s%> above the stars <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3556><s%> of heaven: <S%H8064><s%> the cankerworm <S%H3218><s%> spoileth, <S%H6584><s%> and flieth away. <S%H5774><s%>

Thy crowned <S%H4502><s%> are as the locusts, <S%H697><s%> and thy captains <S%H2951><s%> as the great grasshoppers, <S%H1462><s%> <S%H1462><s%> which camp <S%H2583><s%> in the hedges <S%H1448><s%> in the cold <S%H7135><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> but when the sun <S%H8121><s%> ariseth <S%H2224><s%> they flee away, <S%H5074><s%> and their place <S%H4725><s%> is not known <S%H3045><s%> <S%H3808><s%> where <S%H335><s%> they are.

Thy shepherds <S%H7462><s%> slumber, <S%H5123><s%> O king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria: <S%H804><s%> thy nobles <S%H117><s%> shall dwell <S%H7931><s%> in the dust: thy people <S%H5971><s%> is scattered <S%H6335><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> the mountains, <S%H2022><s%> and no man <S%H369><s%> gathereth <S%H6908><s%> them.

There is no <S%H369><s%> healing <S%H3545><s%> of thy bruise; <S%H7667><s%> thy wound <S%H4347><s%> is grievous: <S%H2470><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> that hear <S%H8085><s%> the bruit <S%H8088><s%> of thee shall clap <S%H8628><s%> the hands <S%H3709><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> thee: for <S%H3588><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> whom <S%H4310><s%> hath not <S%H3808><s%> thy wickedness <S%H7451><s%> passed <S%H5674><s%> continually? <S%H8548><s%>
